post.description:
Self register and return a new user and pseudonym for an account.

If self-registration is enabled on the account, you can use this
endpoint to self register new users.

get.description:
A paginated list of of users associated with this account.

 @example_request
   curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/self/users?search_term=<search value> \
      -X GET \
      -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description:
The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the
results list. Must be at least 3 characters.

Note that the API will prefer matching on canonical user ID if the ID has
a numeric form. It will only search against other fields if non-numeric
in form, or if the numeric value doesn't yield any matches. Queries by
administrative users will search on SIS ID, login ID, name, or email
address; non-administrative queries will only be compared against name.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The column to sort results by.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order to sort the given column by.

post.description:
Create and return a new user and pseudonym for an account.

If you don't have the "Modify login details for users" permission, but
self-registration is enabled on the account, you can still use this
endpoint to register new users. Certain fields will be required, and
others will be ignored (see below).

get.description:
Returns the current user's global activity stream, paginated.

There are many types of objects that can be returned in the activity
stream. All object types have the same basic set of shared attributes:
  !!!javascript
  {
    'created_at': '2011-07-13T09:12:00Z',
    'updated_at': '2011-07-25T08:52:41Z',
    'id': 1234,
    'title': 'Stream Item Subject',
    'message': 'This is the body text of the activity stream item. It is plain-text, and can be multiple paragraphs.',
    'type': 'Discussio

delete.description: Hide all stream items for the user

get.description:
Returns the current user's global activity stream, paginated.

There are many types of objects that can be returned in the activity
stream. All object types have the same basic set of shared attributes:
  !!!javascript
  {
    'created_at': '2011-07-13T09:12:00Z',
    'updated_at': '2011-07-25T08:52:41Z',
    'id': 1234,
    'title': 'Stream Item Subject',
    'message': 'This is the body text of the activity stream item. It is plain-text, and can be multiple paragraphs.',
    'type': 'Discussio
Returns a summary of the current user's global activity stream.
Returns all course nicknames you have set.

delete.description:
Remove the nickname for the given course.
Subsequent course API calls will return the actual name for the course.

get.description: Returns the nickname for a specific course.

put.description:
Set a nickname for the given course. This will replace the course's name
in output of API calls you make subsequently, as well as in selected
places in the Canvas web user interface.

post.summary: Get a Pandata Events jwt token and its expiration date
post.description:
Returns a jwt auth and props token that can be used to send events to
Pandata.

NOTE: This is currently only available to the mobile developer keys.

get.description:
A paginated list of the current user's list of todo items, as seen on the user dashboard.

There is a limit to the number of items returned.

The `ignore` and `ignore_permanently` URLs can be used to update the user's
preferences on what items will be displayed.
Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore` URL will hide that item
from future todo item requests, until the item changes.
Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore_permanently` URL will hide
that item forever.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
"ungraded_quizzes":: Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list.
                     These will be returned under a +quiz+ key instead of an +assignment+ key in response elements.

get.description:
Counts of different todo items such as the number of assignments needing grading as well as the number of assignments needing submitting.

There is a limit to the number of todo items this endpoint will count.
It will only look at the first 100 todo items for the user. If the user has more than 100 todo items this count may not be reliable.
The largest reliable number for both counts is 100.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
"ungraded_quizzes":: Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list.
                     These will be returned under a +quiz+ key instead of an +assignment+ key in response elements.

get.description:
A paginated list of the current user's upcoming events, i.e. the same things shown
in the dashboard 'Coming Up' sidebar.

Shows details for user.

Also includes an attribute "permissions", a non-comprehensive list of permissions for the user.
Example:
  !!!javascript
  "permissions": {
   "can_update_name": true, // Whether the user can update their name.
   "can_update_avatar": false // Whether the user can update their avatar.
  }

put.description: Modify an existing user. To modify a user's login, see the documentation for logins.

get.description: Returns all custom colors that have been saved for a user.

Returns the custom colors that have been saved for a user for a given context.

The asset_string parameter should be in the format 'context_id', for example
'course_42'.

put.description:
Updates a custom color for a user for a given context.  This allows
colors for the calendar and elsewhere to be customized on a user basis.

The asset string parameter should be in the format 'context_id', for example
'course_42'

get.description: Returns all dashboard positions that have been saved for a user.

put.description:
Updates the dashboard positions for a user for a given context.  This allows
positions for the dashboard cards and elsewhere to be customized on a per
user basis.

The asset string parameter should be in the format 'context_id', for example
'course_42'

Merge a user into another user.
To merge users, the caller must have permissions to manage both users. This
should be considered irreversible. This will delete the user and move all
the data into the destination user.

When finding users by SIS ids in different accounts the
destination_account_id is required.

The account can also be identified by passing the domain in destination_account_id.

Merge a user into another user.
To merge users, the caller must have permissions to manage both users. This
should be considered irreversible. This will delete the user and move all
the data into the destination user.

When finding users by SIS ids in different accounts the
destination_account_id is required.

The account can also be identified by passing the domain in destination_account_id.

get.description: Update an existing user's settings.

parameters.name: manual_mark_as_read
parameters.description:
If true, require user to manually mark discussion posts as read (don't
auto-mark as read).

parameters.name: collapse_global_nav
parameters.description: If true, the user's page loads with the global navigation collapsed

post.summary: Split merged users into separate users
post.description:
Merged users cannot be fully restored to their previous state, but this will
attempt to split as much as possible to the previous state.
To split a merged user, the caller must have permissions to manage all of
the users logins. If there are multiple users that have been merged into one
user it will split each merge into a separate user.
A split can only happen within 180 days of a user merge. A user merge deletes
the previous user and may be permanently deleted. In this scenario we create
a new

get.description:
A paginated list of the possible user avatar options that can be set with the user update endpoint. The response will be an array of avatar records. If the 'type' field is 'attachment', the record will include all the normal attachment json fields; otherwise it will include only the 'url' and 'display_name' fields. Additionally, all records will include a 'type' field and a 'token' field. The following explains each field in more detail
type:: ["gravatar"|"attachment"|"no_pic"] The type of avata

delete.description:
Delete custom user data.

Arbitrary JSON data can be stored for a User.  This API call
deletes that data for a given scope.  Without a scope, all custom_data is deleted.
See {api:UsersController#set_custom_data Store Custom Data} for details and
examples of storage and retrieval.

As an example, we'll store some data, then delete a subset of it.

Example {api:UsersController#set_custom_data PUT} with valid JSON data:
  curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/custom_data' \
    -X PUT \

parameters.name: ns
parameters.description:
The namespace from which to delete the data.  This should be something other
Canvas API apps aren't likely to use, such as a reverse DNS for your organization.

get.description:
Load custom user data.

Arbitrary JSON data can be stored for a User.  This API call
retrieves that data for a (optional) given scope.
See {api:UsersController#set_custom_data Store Custom Data} for details and
examples.

On success, this endpoint returns an object containing the data that was requested.

Responds with status code 400 if the namespace parameter, +ns+, is missing or invalid,
or if the specified scope does not contain any data.

parameters.name: ns
parameters.description:
The namespace from which to delete the data.  This should be something other
Canvas API apps aren't likely to use, such as a reverse DNS for your organization.

put.description:
Store arbitrary user data as JSON.

Arbitrary JSON data can be stored for a User.
A typical scenario would be an external site/service that registers users in Canvas
and wants to capture additional info about them.  The part of the URL that follows
+/custom_data/+ defines the scope of the request, and it reflects the structure of
the JSON data to be stored or retrieved.

The value +self+ may be used for +user_id+ to store data associated with the calling user.
In order to access another user's c

post.description:
Upload a file to the user's personal files section.

This API endpoint is the first step in uploading a file to a user's files.
See the {file:file_uploads.html File Upload Documentation} for details on
the file upload workflow.

Note that typically users will only be able to upload files to their
own files section. Passing a user_id of +self+ is an easy shortcut
to specify the current user.

get.description:
A paginated list of past-due assignments for which the student does not have a submission.
The user sending the request must either be an admin or a parent observer using the parent app

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
"ungraded_quizzes":: Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list.
                     These will be returned under a +quiz+ key instead of an +assignment+ key in response elements.

get.description:
Return a paginated list of the user's page view history in json format,
similar to the available CSV download. Page views are returned in
descending order, newest to oldest.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The beginning of the time range from which you want page views.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end of the time range from which you want page views.

get.description:
Returns user profile data, including user id, name, and profile pic.

When requesting the profile for the user accessing the API, the user's
calendar feed URL and LTI user id will be returned as well.
Returns a paginated list of reports for the current context.
Shows all reports that have been run for the account of a specific type.

post.description:
Generates a report instance for the account. Note that "report" in the
request must match one of the available report names. To fetch a list of
available report names and parameters for each report (including whether or
not those parameters are required), see
{api:AccountReportsController#available_reports List Available Reports}.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description:
The parameters will vary for each report. To fetch a list
of available parameters for each report, see {api:AccountReportsController#available_reports List Available Reports}.
A few example parameters have been provided below. Note that the example
parameters provided below may not be valid for every report.

parameters.name: parameters[course_id]
parameters.description:
The id of the course to report on.
Note: this parameter has been listed to serve as an example and may not be
valid for every report.

parameters.name: parameters[users]
parameters.description:
If true, user data will be included. If
false, user data will be omitted. Note: this parameter has been listed to
serve as an example and may not be valid for every report.

get.description: Returns the status of a report.

get.summary: Index of active global notification for the user
get.description:
Returns a list of all global notifications in the account for the current user
Any notifications that have been closed by the user will not be returned

post.description: Create and return a new global notification for an account.

delete.description: If the current user no long wants to see this notification it can be excused with this call

get.description:
Returns a global notification for the current user
A notification that has been closed by the user will not be returned

put.description: Update global notification for an account.

get.description:
A paginated list of accounts that the current user can view or manage.
Typically, students and even teachers will get an empty list in response,
only account admins can view the accounts that they are in.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
"ungraded_quizzes":: Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list.
                     These will be returned under a +quiz+ key instead of an +assignment+ key in response elements.

get.summary: List active courses in an account
get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of courses in this account.

parameters.name: with_enrollments
parameters.description:
If true, include only courses with at least one enrollment.  If false,
include only courses with no enrollments.  If not present, do not filter
on course enrollment status.

parameters.name: enrollment_type
parameters.description:
If set, only return courses that have at least one user enrolled in
in the course with one of the specified enrollment types.

parameters.name: published
parameters.description:
If true, include only published courses.  If false, exclude published
courses.  If not present, do not filter on published status.

parameters.name: completed
parameters.description:
If true, include only completed courses (these may be in state
'completed', or their enrollment term may have ended).  If false, exclude
completed courses.  If not present, do not filter on completed status.

parameters.name: blueprint
parameters.description:
If true, include only blueprint courses. If false, exclude them.
If not present, do not filter on this basis.

parameters.name: blueprint_associated
parameters.description:
If true, include only courses that inherit content from a blueprint course.
If false, exclude them. If not present, do not filter on this basis.

parameters.name: by_teachers
parameters.description:
List of User IDs of teachers; if supplied, include only courses taught by
one of the referenced users.

parameters.name: by_subaccounts
parameters.description:
List of Account IDs; if supplied, include only courses associated with one
of the referenced subaccounts.

parameters.name: hide_enrollmentless_courses
parameters.description:
If present, only return courses that have at least one enrollment.
Equivalent to 'with_enrollments=true'; retained for compatibility.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
If set, only return courses that are in the given state(s). By default,
all states but "deleted" are returned.

parameters.name: enrollment_term_id
parameters.description: If set, only includes courses from the specified term.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description:
The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the
results list. Must be at least 3 characters.

Note that the API will prefer matching on canonical user ID if the ID has
a numeric form. It will only search against other fields if non-numeric
in form, or if the numeric value doesn't yield any matches. Queries by
administrative users will search on SIS ID, login ID, name, or email
address; non-administrative queries will only be compared against name.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
"ungraded_quizzes":: Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list.
                     These will be returned under a +quiz+ key instead of an +assignment+ key in response elements.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The column to sort results by.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order to sort the given column by.

parameters.name: search_by
parameters.description:
The filter to search by. "course" searches for course names, course codes,
and SIS IDs. "teacher" searches for teacher names

get.description:
Returns permission information for the calling user and the given account.
You may use `self` as the account id to check permissions against the domain root account.
The caller must have an account role or admin (teacher/TA/designer) enrollment in a course
in the account. See also {api:CoursesController#permissions the Course counterpart}.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description:
List of permissions to check against the authenticated user.
Permission names are documented in the {api:RoleOverridesController#add_role Create a role} endpoint.

get.summary: Get the sub-accounts of an account
get.description: List accounts that are sub-accounts of the given account.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description:
If true, the entire account tree underneath
this account will be returned (though still paginated). If false, only
direct sub-accounts of this account will be returned. Defaults to false.

post.description: Add a new sub-account to a given account.

parameters.name: account[name]
parameters.description: The name of the new sub-account.

parameters.name: account[sis_account_id]
parameters.description: The account's identifier in the Student Information System.

parameters.name: account[default_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default course storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[default_user_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default user storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[default_group_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default group storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

delete.description:
Cannot delete an account with active courses or active sub_accounts.
Cannot delete a root_account

get.summary: Returns the terms of service for that account

delete.summary: Delete a user from the root account
delete.description:
Delete a user record from a Canvas root account. If a user is associated
with multiple root accounts (in a multi-tenant instance of Canvas), this
action will NOT remove them from the other accounts.

WARNING: This API will allow a user to remove themselves from the account.
If they do this, they won't be able to make API calls or log into Canvas at
that account.

get.description:
Retrieve information on an individual account, given by id or sis
sis_account_id.

parameters.name: account[name]
parameters.description: The name of the new sub-account.

parameters.name: account[sis_account_id]
parameters.description: The account's identifier in the Student Information System.

parameters.name: account[default_time_zone]
parameters.description:
The default time zone of the account. Allowed time zones are
{http://www.iana.org/time-zones IANA time zones} or friendlier
{http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html Ruby on Rails time zones}.

parameters.name: account[default_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default course storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[default_user_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default user storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[default_group_storage_quota_mb]
parameters.description: The default group storage quota to be used, if not otherwise specified.

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_past_view][value]
parameters.description: Restrict students from viewing courses after end date

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_past_view][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_view][value]
parameters.description: Restrict students from viewing courses before start date

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_view][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][lock_all_announcements][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_listing][value]
parameters.description: Restrict students from viewing future enrollments in course list

parameters.name: account[settings][restrict_student_future_listing][locked]
parameters.description: Lock this setting for sub-accounts and courses

parameters.name: account[services]
parameters.description: Give this a set of keys and boolean values to enable or disable services matching the keys

get.description:
A paginated list of accounts that the current user can view through their
admin course enrollments. (Teacher, TA, or designer enrollments).
Only returns "id", "name", "workflow_state", "root_account_id" and "parent_account_id"

content-type.description: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment.

display_name.description: A textual description of the avatar record.

filename.description: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

size.description: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

token.description: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.

type.description: ['gravatar'|'attachment'|'no_pic'] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.

name.description: the actual name of the course

nickname.description: the calling user's nickname for the course

action.description: The rails action that handled the request

app_name.description: If the request is from an API request, the app that generated the access token

asset_type.description: The type of asset in the context for the request, if any

context_type.description: The type of context for the request

contributed.description: This field is deprecated, and will always be false

controller.description: The rails controller that handled the request

http_method.description: The HTTP method such as GET or POST

id.description: A UUID representing the page view.  This is also the unique request id

interaction_seconds.description: An approximation of how long the user spent on the page, in seconds

links.description: The page view links to define the relationships

participated.description: True if the request counted as participating, such as submitting homework

remote_ip.description: The origin IP address of the request

render_time.description: How long the response took to render, in seconds

user_agent.description: The user-agent of the browser or program that made the request

user_request.description: A flag indicating whether the request was user-initiated, or automatic (such as an AJAX call)

account.description: The ID of the account context for this page view

asset.description: The ID of the asset for the request, if any

context.description: The ID of the context for the request (course id if context_type is Course, etc)

real_user.description: The ID of the actual user who made this request, if the request was made by a user who was masquerading

user.description: The ID of the user for this page view

avatar_url.description: The avatar_url can change over time, so we recommend not caching it for more than a few hours

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

name.description: the actual name of the course

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

avatar_url.description: The avatar_url can change over time, so we recommend not caching it for more than a few hours

email.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users primary email address.

enrollments.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return a list of the users active enrollments. See the List enrollments API for more details about the format of these records.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

last_login.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return a timestamp representing the last time the user logged in to canvas.

name.description: the actual name of the course

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to manage SIS information.

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

avatar_image_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

html_url.description: URL to access user, either nested to a context or directly.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

attachment.description: The attachment api object of the report. Only available after the report has completed.

current_line.description: This is the current line count being written to the report. It updates every 1000 records.

ended_at.description: The date and time the report finished processing.

file_url.description: The url to the report download.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

started_at.description: The date and time the report started processing.

ReportParameters.description: The parameters returned will vary for each report.

accounts.description: If true, account data will be included. If false, account data will be omitted.

courses.description: If true, course data will be included. If false, course data will be omitted.

end_at.description: The end date for submissions. Max time range is 2 weeks.

enrollment_state.description: Include enrollment state. Defaults to 'all' Options: ['active'| 'invited'| 'creation_pending'| 'deleted'| 'rejected'| 'completed'| 'inactive'| 'all']

enrollment_term_id.description: The canvas id of the term to get grades from

enrollments.description: If true, enrollment data will be included. If false, enrollment data will be omitted.

groups.description: If true, group data will be included. If false, group data will be omitted.

include_deleted.description: If true, deleted objects will be included. If false, deleted objects will be omitted.

include_enrollment_state.description: If true, enrollment state will be included. If false, enrollment state will be omitted. Defaults to false.

order.description: The order to sort the given column by.

sections.description: If true, section data will be included. If false, section data will be omitted.

start_at.description: The beginning date for submissions. Max time range is 2 weeks.

terms.description: If true, term data will be included. If false, term data will be omitted.

users.description: If true, user data will be included. If false, user data will be omitted.

xlist.description: If true, data for crosslisted courses will be included. If false, data for crosslisted courses will be omitted.

end_at.description: The end date for submissions. Max time range is 2 weeks.

icon.description: The icon to display with the message.  Defaults to warning.

message.description: The message to be sent in the notification.

role_ids.description: The roles to send the notification to.  If roles is not passed it defaults to all roles

roles.description: (Deprecated) The roles to send the notification to.  If roles is not passed it defaults to all roles

start_at.description: The beginning date for submissions. Max time range is 2 weeks.

default_group_storage_quota_mb.description: The storage quota for a group in the account in megabytes, if not otherwise specified

default_storage_quota_mb.description: The storage quota for the account in megabytes, if not otherwise specified

default_time_zone.description: The default time zone of the account. Allowed time zones are {http://www.iana.org/time-zones IANA time zones} or friendlier {http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html Ruby on Rails time zones}.

default_user_storage_quota_mb.description: The storage quota for a user in the account in megabytes, if not otherwise specified

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

lti_guid.description: The account's identifier that is sent as context_id in LTI launches.

name.description: the actual name of the course

parent_account_id.description: The account's parent ID, or null if this is the root account

root_account_id.description: The ID of the root account, or null if this is the root account

sis_account_id.description: The account's identifier in the Student Information System. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to manage SIS information.

workflow_state.description: The state of the account. Can be 'active' or 'deleted'.
